Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice with top of cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of rosette in added white outline with added red dot; below, two faded white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx to left (body, wing, front leg and part of hind leg remaining; with red patches on shoulder and body); dotted square and dot rosette as filling ornament; below, part of two brown bands; at top of cul, trace of probable guilloche pattern.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 256, no. 460, pl. 63)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0527) (phase 2)
